9: The Valley is full of wonders, and must be explored on foot.
15: 🐴 You need the Horseriding skill to travel here.
17: You do not own a hometead here.
19: 🎒 You need a backpack to collect resources away from your homestead.
21: 🎒 Backpack is full. Open Inventory to manage backpack contents.
26: 🎒 You must be at your homestead to empty your backpack.
103: 🐴 Traveling to the next location ... please wait.
104: 🚫 No town in this settlement yet.

201: ✅ Quest completed. You have your reward.
410: 🏕️ To use a purchased tent, click on your own player icon.
1001: Inventory: Resources collected at the Homestead will go into the warehouse. Resources collected in town or in the valley will go into the backpack. To buy a backpack, go to Skills. Crafting stations will only pull items from the warehouse. You can empty your backpack into the warehouse anytime you are on your Homestead.
1002: Build: Build crafting stations on your Homestead using resources from your warehouse.
1003: Purchased animals will appear at your player icon, and immediately begin life on the homestead.
1004: Till land to dirt in order to plant crops. Plant grass to give farm animals something to graze on.
1005: Acquire Skills and Upgrades to improve various attributes. Make sure to explore the Town to find additional places and ways to gain Skills and Upgrades.
1006: Manage all of your ongoing quests here. Look for quest-giving characters on your homestead as well as Town, or even the Valley.
1007: Governments in Valley View are formed at the settlement level. The mayor and their cabinet manage shared resources, settle disputes, and implement policies to help the community thrive.
1008: Trade Stall: Sell your resources to other players or buy items from their trade stalls. Use the arrows to navigate between trade stalls within your Settlement. If no other players buy your items, you can always sell them to the game for 25% of their value.
1011: This Animal Stall is empty. Make sure animals have grass to eat, and they will eventually come to the stall for harvesting.
1012: Elections take place in the Courthouse. Here, Mayors have the power to set the tax rate and rename the Settlement.
1015: The game takes place over the course of continually changing seasons. At the end of a season, a portion of your wealth and rare items will carry over. Upgrade to a Gold account for more carry-over benefits.
1017: Visit the Bank to exchange items for Money, including rare items like Gold and Silver. Return to the bank regulalry for different offers.

3004: The tax rate is set by the Mayor, for this Settlement, and a percentage of all taxes collected are added to the Mayor's account.
3005: Mayors are elected at the Courthouse in Town.
3009: Only the Mayor can build Schools, Hospitals and Animal Yards in the Town.
3010: 🏫 Schools give citizens access to certain Skills that cannot be gained elsewhere.
3011: 🏥 Hospitals supply Doctors, who can heal adventurers returning from the Valley.
3012: 🐾 Animal Yards supply unique livestock, which can be transported back to Homesteads by any player.
3013: 🚂 The Mayor can influence demand for goods at the Train.
